description: Surrogate primary key for the form configuration record.
Human-readable identifier or title of the form shown in the application.
Indicates whether this is the default form layout for the related entity/type.
Domain entity type this form is designed to create, view, or edit.
Relative path to the persisted XML definition file for this form.
Encoded configuration flags controlling form behavior or features (e.g., security, UI options); likely a bitmask or enum; confirm with SME.
Enumerated mode controlling how the form binds or interacts with data (e.g., single-record vs list, read-only vs editable); exact meanings of values require confirmation with SME.
Stored script/template defining client or server logic for this form (events, rules, validations). If empty, logic is external or not used.
Inline XML layout/template for the form, used to render fields and sections when not loading from an external file.
Reference or embedded code-behind implementing form behavior beyond the template (handlers, validation, automation); likely script or compiled assembly reference; confirm with SME.
Free-text description of the formâ€™s purpose or usage.
Identifier of the user who created this form record.
Timestamp when this form record was created.
Identifier of the user who last modified this form record.
Timestamp when this form record was last modified.
